It offers swimmable waters and breathtaking sunset views over the Arabian Sea. The beach is known for its clean sandy and rocky landscape and is popular among couples and youngsters seeking solace away from city life. Versova Beach also features a colorful fishing village with a vibrant fish market, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and enjoying mesmerizing sunsets.A Perfect place to hang out with friends. Versova beach is no exception. 10 mins walking distance from Versova Metro Station. If walking, avoid going by the slums route (near thorats barbecue misal) because there's a lot of trash and snack stalls are far. Walk a little more and take Persian Darbar's route aka Main Entrance (extra 5-10 mins walking). Sharing rickshaw from the metro station will cost 20rs per person, it will drop you near the main entrance. Kalkhatta Gola is for 50rs, Mix Gola is for 60rs. You can tell the vendor to make a normal Gola to avoid fancy heart shape. You can rent a beach mat for 150rs or sit on the rocks. Don't throw litter, carry your trash out with you and dispose it in a dustbin. Be responsible and enjoy!Draksha K ‚Äî Google reviewAmazing, quiet beach. What a difference from crowded Juhu beach. Keep up the good work !Munish P ‚Äî Google reviewVersova Beach is a hidden gem nestled in the bustling city of Mumbai. With its long stretch of golden sand, the beach is perfect for an early morning stroll or winding down after a hectic day. The rhythmic sound of the waves, the cool sea breeze, and the distant call of the fishermen setting out to sea create a serene atmosphere that‚Äôs hard to find in a metro city. Top Highlights of this Beach ‚Äì ‚Ä¢ Scenic views: Versova‚Äôs coastline offers a beautiful sunrise view with the sea reflecting soft pastels. It‚Äôs an ideal spot for photographers and nature lovers. ‚Ä¢ Cleanliness efforts: The beach has come a long way, thanks to regular clean-up drives organized by local volunteers. You‚Äôll often see community members picking up plastic and debris, making the shoreline more enjoyable. ‚Ä¢ Community vibe: There‚Äôs a strong local presence here. Fishermen at work, kids flying kites, and families spending time together give the beach a warm, communal feel. Things to Know: ‚Ä¢ Crowd levels: Weekends and evenings can get busy, especially during festive seasons. If you prefer tranquility, visiting early in the morning is best. ‚Ä¢ Facilities: Basic amenities are available public toilets and a few food stalls serving chai, snacks, and seafood. However, don‚Äôt expect luxury caf√©s or upscale eateries. ‚Ä¢ Safety: The sea can be rough at times. Swim only in designated zones and stay near lifeguard-patrolled areas. The beach is generally safe during daylight hours. My Experience: I visited on a serene weekday morning. The cool breeze, soft sand underfoot, and the sight of fishermen mending nets made it a calming escape. I joined a local clean-up drive, which added meaning to my visit. Though facilities are simple, the real charm lies in the untouched, local ambience. Overall, Versova Beach is a must-visit for anyone looking for a quieter, more authentic Ayurvedic sea-breeze escape in Mumbai. I‚Äôd recommend adding your own touch by participating in volunteer activities or simply enjoying a peaceful walk.Amandeep G ‚Äî Google reviewNeed to be cleaned, else good place for spending time with your loved onesTech U ‚Äî Google reviewBharat Nagar, Versova, Andheri West, Maharashtra, India‚Ä¢Tips and more reviews for Versova Beach4Gorai BeachSave4.2(6236)‚Ä¢3.5(178)‚Ä¢Mentioned on¬†+16 other lists¬†BeachOutdoor ActivitiesGorai Beach, nestled in the Gorai creek near Essel World, is a popular day-trip destination for locals. Situated in the western suburbs near Ville Parle station, this beach is a popular family destination offering breathtaking sunsets and a variety of delectable street food such as bhelpuri, pav bhaji, vada pav, and local treats. Unlike other crowded beaches in Mumbai, Marv√© Beach provides a serene environment for leisurely strolls along the shore while admiring the picturesque Arabian Sea views.Marve Beach, nestled in the western suburbs of Mumbai, offers a refreshing escape from the bustling city life. This picturesque beach, located in Malad West, is a hidden gem that attracts both locals and tourists seeking tranquility and natural beauty. The beach boasts a serene atmosphere, with soft golden sands stretching along the Arabian Sea. The calm waters and gentle waves make it an ideal spot for relaxation and rejuvenation. The scenic beauty of the surrounding area, with lush greenery and charming coastal villas, adds to the overall charm of Marve Beach. One of the highlights of Marve Beach is the stunning sunset. As the sun dips below the horizon, the sky is painted with vibrant hues of orange, pink, and purple, creating a breathtaking spectacle. Many visitors gather on the beach to witness this awe-inspiring natural phenomenon. While swimming is not recommended due to strong currents, visitors can enjoy other activities such as beachcombing, sunbathing, and leisurely walks along the shoreline. The beach also offers opportunities for water sports like kayaking and paddleboarding, adding an element of adventure to the experience. For those seeking a more cultural experience, Marve Beach is home to a small Portuguese church, adding a touch of history to the coastal landscape. The beach is also a popular spot for photography enthusiasts, capturing the serene beauty of the surroundings. However, it's important to note that Marve Beach can get crowded during weekends and holidays. Additionally, the cleanliness of the beach can vary, so it's advisable to visit during weekdays or early mornings to enjoy a more peaceful experience. Overall, Marve Beach is a delightful escape from the urban chaos of Mumbai. Its serene ambiance, stunning sunsets, and natural beauty make it a perfect destination for those seeking a tranquil and rejuvenating experience.Harshad P ‚Äî Google reviewVery bad and village type of creek and more like dhobi Tallao..there are thelas on it and public is mostly fisherman and villagers ...water is full of garbage...and very dusty and one cannot stand even there for 5 mins..AVOID AND DO NOT GO ...pathetic experience..photos are all fake...people do not show true picture and condition..Aditi S ‚Äî Google reviewThe sunset view is amazing. Rated 4.5/5 stars. The beach was clean, peaceful, and not crowded, which made it perfect for swimming and relaxing. We swam from 1 PM to 6 PM, and the changing tide levels throughout the day added to the experience. Around 1 PM, the water was shallow and far from the rocks, but by 5‚Äì6 PM, the waves had risen and started hitting the stones at the edge of the beach. Sitting on those rocks and feeling the waves crash against me was just an amazing feeling. Just a heads-up‚Äîthe water is extremely salty. I had a bit of discomfort in my eyes, and even got a slight ear infection, but it‚Äôs all fine now after a doctor visit. We carried biryani, had a mini picnic in the evening, and responsibly cleaned the area before leaving. There were a few local food stalls nearby too. It‚Äôs a great spot for photography, family outings, or just peace of mind. Tips for first-time visitors: Avoid going deep if you don‚Äôt know how to swim. Carry your own food and water‚Äîbut please clean up afterward. Best time to visit is early morning or late afternoon to avoid harsh heat. The tide level rises in the evening, so plan your swim time accordingly. It is known for its clear water and stunning views of the city. Mahim Beach is a great place to relax and enjoy the scenic beauty of the beaches.Ah, Mahim Beach! It‚Äôs one of the more understated beaches in Mumbai, compared to its more famous counterparts like Juhu or Marine Drive, but it has its own charm. ### Mahim Beach Overview: - **Location**: Situated in the Mahim area, this beach offers a quiet escape from the hustle and bustle of Mumbai city. It's located near the Mahim Causeway, making it fairly accessible. - **Scenic View**: The beach offers views of the Arabian Sea, but the surrounding environment isn‚Äôt as pristine as some of the more popular beaches in Mumbai. There's a view of the Mahim Bay and the Bandra-Worli Sea Link from a distance, though it‚Äôs not as iconic as the one from the Bandra Sea Face area. - **Atmosphere**: It‚Äôs generally a quieter spot compared to other beaches. On weekdays, it‚Äôs calm, but on weekends, it can attract some locals. You‚Äôll find people strolling, playing cricket, or simply sitting and enjoying the breeze. However, the beach isn‚Äôt the cleanest, which can be a turn-off for some visitors. - **Activities**: While Mahim Beach isn't particularly famous for water sports, you can often find people walking along the shore or kids playing. It‚Äôs more of a spot for relaxation and casual visits. - **Nearby Attractions**: The famous **Mahim Dargah** is located close to the beach, which is a popular religious site. There are also some cafes and small eateries nearby, so grabbing a bite is never a problem. ### Pros: - **Less Crowded**: Compared to other beaches like Juhu or Marine Drive, Mahim Beach tends to be less crowded, offering a more laid-back experience. - **Local Vibe**: The area feels authentically Mumbai, with local vendors, small shops, and residents going about their daily lives. ### Cons: - **Cleanliness**: The beach isn‚Äôt as well-maintained as other tourist-heavy beaches in the city. You may find some litter and debris around the shore. - **Water Quality**: Like many other Mumbai beaches, the water quality isn‚Äôt great for swimming. It's not the most ideal beach for water activities. ### Final Thoughts: Mahim Beach isn‚Äôt the most glamorous beach in Mumbai, but it offers a quieter, local experience. If you‚Äôre looking for a more peaceful, off-the-beaten-path location to unwind, it's a good choice. Just keep your expectations in check regarding cleanliness and amenities.Tasmiya S ‚Äî Google reviewFirst of all it's not a beach as such. Just a sea view spot. The shores are pretty dirty. This area holds the distinction of being Mumbai's first planned locality and serves as a hub for the city's Marathi culture.Mumbai, Maharashtra, India‚Ä¢Tips and more reviews for Dadar28UranSaveMentioned on¬†¬†Uran is a charming coastal town located in the Raigad District of Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra. Positioned to the east of Mumbai, across the Dharamtar Creek, Uran started as a fishing and agriculture village but has since evolved into a special economic zone. Situated at the end of Navi Mumbai, this picturesque town lies in the Konkan division between Panvel and Karjat.Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra, India‚Ä¢Tips and more reviews for Uran29GoraiSaveMentioned on¬†¬†Gorai, situated in Mumbai, India, is a charming village located on the northwestern part of Salsette Island. Accessible by ferry across Manori Creek and Gorai Creek or by an overland route through Bhayander, this picturesque destination offers a serene escape from the bustling city life.Mumbai, Maharashtra, India‚Ä¢Tips and more reviews for Gorai30Uttan Virgin BeachSave4.3(300)‚Ä¢3.9(31)BeachOutdoor ActivitiesUttan Virgin Beach is a secluded and laid-back spot popular for swimming, sunbathing, and picnicking. It can be easily reached by bus or rickshaw from Bhayandar West, offering scenic beauty along the way. While it may not be the cleanest beach and could have some drunkards due to its fish port, it provides various landscapes for picturesque photography. Visitors are advised to avoid the rough stones on the calm beach as they can be dangerous.Very beautiful place. Very beautiful! Surprisingly very clean beach. Roads are very good and clean. The scenic beauty during the travel is also excellent. You can come with friends or family for a one day picnic. It's very peaceful. You would love it!
